task_summary: Navigate down a hallway to reach a goal location.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile robot, starting in a corridor (Cory Hall), is tasked to navigate to a 'goal' location, which appears to be at the far end of the hallway. The robot must move forward, maintaining its path. The visual sequence shows the robot proceeding down the hall, encountering a person walking in the opposite direction (frames 4-5), and then maneuvering sharply near the right wall (frames 6-8), which could be an avoidance maneuver or part of a turn.
preconditions: Robot is localized at the starting position in the hallway.
stepwise_plan: Execute a single navigation action to the predefined 'goal' location.
success_criteria: Robot reaches the 'goal' location within the time limit.
failure_and_recovery: Failure if the robot collides with the walls or the person. Recovery (e.g., local obstacle avoidance) is assumed to be handled by the underlying implementation of the 'NavigateToNamed' action.
task_long_description.termination: The task terminates when the 'NavigateToNamed' action returns Success (goal reached) or Failure (timeout or planner failure).

frame_3.now_evidence: Clear view of the hallway, establishing the navigation path.
frame_3.predicts_next: Continued forward motion towards the goal.

frame_5.now_evidence: Dynamic obstacle (person) is clearly visible, triggering avoidance logic.
frame_5.predicts_next: A deviation from the center-line path is expected.

node_specs.description: Executes a navigation plan to a predefined symbolic location. Assumed to include local planning and obstacle avoidance.

recovery_strategy: Relies on the underlying planner of 'NavigateToNamed' for local obstacle avoidance.
assumptions: The 'NavigateToNamed' action encapsulates a full navigation stack (global planner, local planner, controller, and obstacle avoidance).
The 'goal' is a known location_id in the robot's map.
The entire 9-frame sequence depicts a single, continuous execution of the 'NavigateToNamed' action.
The sharp turn/veer in frames [6]-[8] is part of the robot's local planning (e.g., obstacle avoidance or cornering) and not a separate, high-level action.

expected_success_criteria: Robot successfully reaches the 'goal' location without collision.
